widget:CodeSection.description: You can easily add placeholder to indicate a label into your datepicker.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker placeholder="Date" grid="s12 m4"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: You can disable the datepicker by adding enabled='false'

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker placeholder="Birthday" enabled="false" grid="s12 m4"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: You can set easily the selection type of your datepicker by adding an attribute, selectionType='YEAR'. Here is the available formats [DAY, MONTH_DAY, YEAR_MONTH_DAY, YEAR]

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker placeholder="Date" selectionType="YEAR" grid="s12 m4"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: Set whether the parent of the root picker should be attached. For Dialogs it is good to use BODY instead of SELF container.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialRow> <m:MaterialDatePicker placeholder="Picker attached on its own (SELF)" container="SELF" selectionType="YEAR" grid="s12 m4"/> <m:MaterialDatePicker placeholder="Picker attached on root (BODY)" container="BODY" selectionType="YEAR" grid="s12 m4"/> </m:MaterialRow>

widget:CodeSection.description: You can easily adjust how many years to display in listbox. Good for Birthdate

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpBirthdate" placeholder="Birthdate" selectionType="YEAR" yearsToDisplay="50" grid="s12 m4"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: Provides a way to automatically closes the datepicker after selecting dates.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpAutoClose" grid="s12 m4" autoClose="true" placeholder="Date" />

widget:CodeSection.description: Open this time picker on a mobile device to test.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker detectOrientation="true" grid="s12 m4" placeholder="Supports mobile orientations" />

<m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dp" grid="s12 m4" placeholder="Date" selectionType="YEAR"/> <m:MaterialButton ui:field="btnSetDate" text="Set Date to January 1, 2016" marginRight="20" marginTop="24"/> <m:MaterialButton ui:field="btnGetDate" text="Get the date" marginTop="24"/>

<m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpValue" placeholder="DatePicker" grid="s12 m4" /> <m:MaterialButton text="Set Value" ui:field="btnDpValue" marginRight="20" marginTop="24"/> <m:MaterialButton text="Set Value with Event" ui:field="btnDpValueEvent" marginTop="24"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: You can set the format of the date picker by adding format='FORMAT'

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpFormat" grid="s12 m4" placeholder="Custom Format" format="YYYY/MM/DD"/> <m:MaterialButton ui:field="btnSetFormat" text="Set Date with custom format" marginTop="24"/>

widget:CodeSection.description: The following rules can be used to format any date supported by Pickadate JS (Our core datepicker API)

tr.td: Date of the month with a leading zero
Day of the week in short form
Day of the week in full form
Month of the year with a leading zero

widget:CodeSection.description: You can limit the date by calling setDateLimit(Date min, Date max) method.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpLimit" placeholder="With Limit"/>
dpLimit.setDateMin(new Date(117, 0, 1)); dpLimit.setDateMax(new Date(117, 0, 15));

widget:CodeSection.description: You can control programmatically the date picker. We added value change event with datepicker.close() upon triggering the event.

g:HTMLPanel.pre: <m:MaterialRow> <m:MaterialDatePicker ui:field="dpOpenClose" grid="s12 m4" placeholder="Birthdate" /> </m:MaterialRow> <m:MaterialButton ui:field="btnOpen" text="Open DatePicker" marginTop="24"/>
